text: Not sure if that's helpful to see the full CSS <@UQWGKUEN7>, but I made a few adjustments based on your suggestion and it's not quite right, maybe you can point me more precisely in the right direction with the original code above!
<@UTQQ4TXCH> this is a form I'm going to use in several places
You have 2 options override all inputs css that means that all your forms will have the same look or you can target the form ID then inputs.
<@UTQQ4TXCH> I want to target that specific form ID and make changes to that form only. I have the form ID
Here is an example
Try using this and replace the numbers with the form Id
Let me know if that doesn’t work I have done it serval ways and can’t remember how I did it last. I usually just do it on the fly and get the targeting from the inspector code.
Ok double checked if you are using the formId number you got from the embed code when publishing the form you will want to target it like this
.hsForm_then-your-form-number     then you can target each area to style.
This is awesome! I'm working on it now. I want to make sure I'm doing this correctly. Everything I have in the html I can keep. I'm only adding this new .hsForm etc in the CSS section right?

Nvm, I changed the background color and it's showing now. Thank you!

Though where can I find the properties of the form so I can target the gray background? <@UTQQ4TXCH>
Do you have it on a page I could see?
Try this to target the form in general and add background: white Example `#hs_form_target_module_1111111111 { background: white; }`
or `.hsForm_c947ee0d-662b-48a1-a5ab-dc1xxxxxxxxxxx`
Whichever you are using
